email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding your inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, with a DWT of 150,000 and an LOA of 280 meters. The laycan is 15-20 October. Our starting freight quote is in the low 50s, say $50.75 per metric ton. Let me know your thoughts. Best regards, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The vessel details look good, but the freight rate is a bit higher than expected. Could you consider moving to the mid-40s, say $47.50 per metric ton? Also, can we confirm the laycan is firm? Looking forward to your reply. Cheers, John.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I understand your position, but $47.50 is a bit tight given current market conditions. How about we meet in the middle at $49.00 per metric ton? The laycan is firm, and we can include a demurrage rate of $20,000 per day, pro rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the revised offer. $49.00 is acceptable, provided the demurrage rate is reduced to $18,000 per day. Also, can we confirm the cargo size is 140,000 metric tons? Let’s finalize this soon. Regards, John.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, we can agree to the demurrage rate of $18,000 per day. The cargo size is confirmed at 140,000 metric tons. I’ll prepare the charter party agreement with the agreed terms: freight rate of $49.00 per metric ton, laycan 15-20 October, and demurrage at $18,000 per day. Let me know if you need anything else. Best, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, everything looks good. Please proceed with the charter party agreement. Thanks for your flexibility, and let’s keep in touch for future shipments. Cheers, John.
